result.execSummary:
The defendant Will Haywood Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Will Haywood Jr is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Will Haywood Jr was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Will Haywood Jr was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Will Haywood in court.  Sarah Zwach appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
  DOC agent also in court.
Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered that time in the House of Correction, which was ordered as a condition of probation but stayed to today's date, be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.

Defendant Will Haywood in court with attorney Awni M Yasin.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
cab
 Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing. 
As to counts 1 and 2:
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 75 days in the House of Correction as to count 1 and 75 days in the House of Correction as to count 2,  concurrent, with credit for 3 days served. 
 Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 12 months, concurrent,  with the following conditions:
- Serve 25 days in the House of Correction as to count 2; STAYED pending review.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment if it is deemed there is an issue.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens, if treatment is necessary for AODA.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim or her son unless approved by the court.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
- Pay supervision fees.
- Court set restitution at zero.
 
Received and filed: 
Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
The next court date is in Branch 36.
  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for February 19, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
cab

Defendant Will Haywood in court with attorney Awni M Yasin.  Molly Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Case was calendared for a jury trial today.
The defendant wants to change his plea.
As to counts 1 and 2:
As to both counts, on motion of the state and pursuant to negotiations, the penalty enhancers, While armed with a dangerous weapon, are dismissed.
.
As to counts 1 and 2:
  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he/she is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he/she is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 
.
As to count 3:
On motion of the state and pursuant to negotiations, court ordered count 3 dismissed.
Case set for sentencing in Branch 36.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Will Haywood in court with attorney Awni M Yasin.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

 Final pretrial conference held.  Defendant rejects State's offer. Court informs parties all offers are off the table.  Case remains calendared on 09/23/2015 at 08:30 a.m. for jury trial in Branch 36.

Defendant Will Haywood in court with attorney Awni M Yasin.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Jury Trial. State's witnesses on call, defense previously advised the state and the court defendant intended to enter a plea in this matter. Defendant no longer wishes to enter a plea and requests to proceed to trial. Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502. Case adjourned to branch 36 for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received & Filed, Justice Point Report.

Defendant Will Haywood in court with attorney Crystal L. Saltzwadel.  Matthew James Torbenson for Molly Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case heard off the record.
